pt: {sc}clever{/sc} {sc}adroit{/sc} {sc}cunning{/sc} {sc}ingenious{/sc} mean having or showing practical wit or skill in contriving. {sc}clever{/sc} stresses physical or mental quickness, deftness, or great aptitude.
{sc}adroit{/sc} often implies a skillful use of expedients to achieve one's purpose in spite of difficulties.
{sc}cunning{/sc} implies great skill in constructing or creating.

pt.t: a filmmaker {it}cunning{/it} in his use of special effects

pt: {sc}ingenious{/sc} suggests the power of inventing or discovering a new way of accomplishing something.

quotes.t: The old lady was {qword}clever{/qword} enough and he thought that if she had started from any of the right premises, more might have been expected of her.
Those who can't write poetry, write {qword}clever{/qword} letters to the editor. Those who can't write {qword}clever{/qword} letters to the editor, write angry letters to the editor.
Some thought he had no redeeming value whatsoever. A sociopath. A {qword}clever{/qword} manipulator …
All of Laptsev went to stare at the bride-to-be—she was no beauty, but everyone could see that she was {qword}clever{/qword}, sophisticated …
… the three of them may give Gray Davis, who was too {qword}clever{/qword} for his own good, his comeuppance.
